   - Specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China, not as part of a broader tariff.

Suppose the condition regarding the interview is met. Then, will the outcome regarding the tariff not occur by the specified date?

para_P.title: IF Elon Musk holds a live discussion with Sergey Brin on X before August 2024, will the United States impose a substantial tariff on electric vehicles produced in China by that same date?
para_P.body:
This conditional inquiry examines the connection between two occurrences:

1. **Condition (P):** Elon Musk holds a live discussion with Sergey Brin on X (previously Twitter) prior to August 31, 2024. This necessitates:
   - The discussion to occur live on the X platform.
   - Elon Musk as the main interviewer and Sergey Brin as the one being interviewed.
   - An official announcement by X or Elon Musk ahead of the event.
   - The discussion to be publicly accessible on X.
   - Coverage by at least two major news organizations (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press).

2. **Outcome (Q):** The United States enacts a tariff of 50% or greater on the importation of electric vehicles manufactured in China by August 31, 2024. This must be:
   - Officially verified by announcements from the U.S. government.
   - Reported by at least two major news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times).
   - Specifically aimed at electric vehicles made in China, not as part of a wider tariff.

Assuming the condition about the discussion is fulfilled, will the outcome concerning the tariff also take place by the given date?

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X, and (2) the United States implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter). For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   - The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
   - Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
   - Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
   - The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
   - The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
   - At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

2. The United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles.

If both of these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met by this date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X, nor (2) the United States implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter). For a positive resolution, the following criteria must NOT be met:

   - Sergey Brin must NOT be the interviewee.
   - The event must NOT be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
   - The interview must NOT be publicly accessible on the X platform.
   - At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must NOT report on the event either before or after it takes place.

2. The United States must NOT officially implement a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must NOT be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and NOT reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must NOT be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and NOT part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles.

If neither of these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is met by this date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (1) Elon Musk interviews Sergey Brin live on X, and (2) the U.S. imposes a significant tariff on electric vehicles made in China?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if both of the following events occur by August 31, 2024:

   - The event should be officially announced by either X or Elon Musk prior to happening.
   - The interview needs to be publicly available on the X platform.
   - At least two prominent news organizations (like CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must cover the event either before or after it occurs.

2. The United States officially enacts a tariff of 50% or more on imports of electric vehicles produced in China. This implementation must be validated by official announcements from the U.S. government and reported by a minimum of two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must specifically target electric vehicles manufactured in China and not be part of a wider tariff affecting all Chinese products or all vehicles.

If both of these conditions are fulfilled by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered as YES. If either condition is unmet by that date, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will Spotify announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Spotify officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Spotify only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 2% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Spotify not announce any additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if Spotify does not officially announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The absence of such an announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. If such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Spotify provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 2% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be further layoffs at Spotify exceeding the initially disclosed 2% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if Spotify makes an official declaration of additional layoffs that surpass the initially disclosed 2% of its staff by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from official company announcements or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The new layoffs must be distinctly separate from the previously reported 2% workforce decrease. If no further layoffs are declared by the deadline, or if Spotify only shares updates or clarifications regarding the initially reported 2% reduction without announcing any new layoffs, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Given Spotify announces additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024, will the Reserve Bank of India announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body:
This question considers two events: 

1. **Condition**: Will Spotify announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024? To resolve as YES, Spotify must officially announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by the specified date, confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The additional layoffs must be separate from the initially reported reduction.

2. **Outcome**: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024? To resolve as YES, the Reserve Bank of India must publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate (repo rate) by the specified date, reported by at least two reputable financial news sources. The reduction must be concrete, not merely hinted or speculated.

The question asks: If Spotify announces additional layoffs as described, will the Reserve Bank of India also announce a reduction in its key interest rate by the same date?

not_P.title: Given Spotify does not announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024, will the Reserve Bank of India not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question considers two events: 

1. **Condition**: Will Spotify not announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024? To resolve as YES, Spotify must not officially announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by the specified date, confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The additional layoffs must be separate from the initially reported reduction.

2. **Outcome**: Will the Reserve Bank of India not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024? To resolve as YES, the Reserve Bank of India must not publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate (repo rate) by the specified date, reported by at least two reputable financial news sources. The reduction must be concrete, not merely hinted or speculated.

The question asks: If Spotify does not announce additional layoffs as described, will the Reserve Bank of India also not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by the same date?

para_P.title: If Spotify reveals further job cuts exceeding the initially stated 2% by August 2024, will the Reserve Bank of India declare a decrease in its primary interest rate by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines two scenarios: 

1. **Condition**: Will Spotify disclose further job reductions beyond the initially indicated 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024? For this to be considered YES, Spotify must officially confirm additional layoffs exceeding the initially reported 2% by the specified deadline, as verified through official company announcements or reports from at least two credible news outlets. The new layoffs must be distinct from the previously reported decrease.

2. **Outcome**: Will the Reserve Bank of India make a public announcement regarding a decrease in its main interest rate by August 31, 2024? For this to be considered YES, the Reserve Bank of India must officially announce a reduction in its main interest rate (repo rate) by the specified date, as reported by at least two reputable financial news organizations. The reduction must be definitive, not merely suggested or speculated.

The question is: If Spotify announces additional layoffs as outlined, will the Reserve Bank of India likewise announce a reduction in its primary interest rate by the same date?

The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. (2) The Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If either of these events does not occur by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords not pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must not be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must not be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If such a bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the House of Lords in the United Kingdom approve a significant economic reform legislation that Prime Minister Sunak opposes before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom approves a significant economic reform legislation that is clearly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To be considered:

1. The legislation must pertain to economic policy, including fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It needs to be approved by the House of Lords, regardless of its enactment into law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be distinctly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets regarding its potential effect on the UK economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is approved but does not satisfy all the aforementioned conditions, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given the UK House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak, will Apple finalize a union contract with Ohio store employees by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, and must be passed by the House of Lords. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy. 

Then, will Apple finalize and officially sign a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio by July 31, 2024? The contract must be confirmed by official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. The bill must not be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, and must not be passed by the House of Lords. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

para_P.title: If the House of Lords in the UK enacts a significant economic reform bill that Prime Minister Sunak opposes, will Apple complete a union agreement with its employees in Ohio by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom enacts a significant economic reform bill that is clearly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his government. Then, will Apple successfully finalize and officially endorse a collective bargaining agreement with the unionized employees at its Ohio stores by July 31, 2024? This contract must be validated through official statements from Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or reported by at least two credible news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, or prominent national newspapers). This contract should represent the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If the contract is not finalized and signed by the specified date, or if it remains tentative or not fully completed, the answer to the question will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the UK's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill opposed by PM Sunak by August 2024, and (b) Apple finalizes a union contract with Ohio store employees by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

2. By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States.

If either or both of these conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

2. By July 31, 2024, Apple has not finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must not come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must not be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States.

If either or both of these conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following two events to happen: (a) the House of Lords in the UK approves a significant economic reform bill that Prime Minister Sunak opposes by August 2024, and (b) Apple completes a union agreement with employees at its Ohio stores by July 2024?

This confirmation should come from official statements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or prominent national newspapers). This contract must represent the first of its type for Apple in the United States.

If either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Italian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Italy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy has not slipped into a recession. For this context, a recession is characterized by two back-to-back quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The answer will be NO if Italy's economy faces two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Given the Italian economy avoids a recession by July 2024, will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

Then, will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024? The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). This question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

not_P.title: Given the Italian economy avoids a recession by July 2024, will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure not show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

Then, will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) report a month-over-month increase of 0.5% or less in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024? The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). This question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will India's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?

question.title: Conditional on India's central bank's preferred inflation measure showing a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024, will Uber lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times).

Then, is it true that Uber will lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 31, 2024, as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan? Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023.

not_P.title: Conditional on India's central bank's preferred inflation measure showing a monthly increase not exceeding 0.5% by July 2024, will Uber not lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?

Then, is it true that Uber will not lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 31, 2024, as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan? Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023.

para_P.title: If India's central bank's favored inflation indicator indicates a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% by July 2024, will Uber terminate at least 1,800 jobs by that same month?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: India's central bank's favored inflation indicator shows a month-over-month rise greater than 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This rise must be officially reported by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian governmental body and covered by at least two trustworthy financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times).

Then, is it accurate to say that Uber will reduce its workforce by at least 1,800 employees by July 31, 2024, as part of its AI-driven restructuring strategy? Confirmation should come from official company statements, regulatory submissions, or reports by a minimum of two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The job cuts must be directly associated with the AI-driven restructuring strategy announced in 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% and (b) Uber lays off at least 1,800 employees?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, this part of the question will resolve as NO. (b) Uber has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution. If both (a) and (b) occur, the question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% nor (b) Uber lays off at least 1,800 employees?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If such an increase is reported during this period, this part of the question will resolve as NO. (b) Uber has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a number of layoffs meeting or exceeding 1,800 employees, or if such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as NO. Any layoffs or phased implementations that reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution. If neither (a) nor (b) occur, the question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) India's central bank's favored inflation indicator experiences a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% and (b) Uber dismisses a minimum of 1,800 workers?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (a) India's central bank's favored inflation indicator shows a month-over-month increase that exceeds 0.5% in any single month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially reported by the Reserve Bank of India or an appropriate Indian governmental body and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is documented during this timeframe, this component of the question will be answered as NO. (b) Uber has officially acknowledged the termination of at least 1,800 employees as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. This confirmation must come from official company statements, regulatory disclosures, or reports by at least two trustworthy news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan that was announced in 2023. If Uber verifies a lesser number of layoffs, or if there is no confirmation that meets these stipulations by the resolution date, this section of the question will also conclude as NO. Partial layoffs or gradual implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 employee count by the resolution date will likewise lead to a NO outcome. If both (a) and (b) take place, the question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will France appoint a new President by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will France not appoint a new President by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, no new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must not be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If a new President is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, does not remain in office, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that France will have a new President by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially designated in France. The confirmation must come from official government announcements or be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the sake of this inquiry, a 'new' President refers to someone who is not currently holding this position as of October 1, 2023. If a new President is not appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, continues to serve, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Conditional on France appointing a new President by August 2024, will the Bank of England's base rate remain at or above 5.00% in August 2024?
question.body:
This question examines the potential correlation between political changes in France and monetary policy in the UK. 

Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. 

Then, is it true that the Bank of England's base rate will remain at or above 5.00% in August 2024? This will resolve as YES if the Bank of England's base rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 5.00% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

If the condition about France appointing a new President is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on France not appointing a new President by August 2024, will the Bank of England's base rate be below 5.00% in August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question examines the potential correlation between political changes in France and monetary policy in the UK. 

Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, a new President is not officially appointed in France. The appointment must not be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. 

Then, is it true that the Bank of England's base rate will be below 5.00% in August 2024? This will resolve as YES if the Bank of England's base rate is reported to be below 5.00% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% and remains at or above this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

If the condition about France appointing a new President is met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If France has a new President by August 2024, will the Bank of England's base interest rate stay at or above 5.00% in August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry investigates the possible link between political shifts in France and the monetary policy of the UK. 

Assuming the following holds: By August 31, 2024, a new President is officially designated in France. This appointment must be validated by official government announcements or reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). In this context, a 'new' President refers to someone who is not currently holding this position as of October 1, 2023. 

Then, can it be affirmed that the Bank of England's base interest rate will persist at or above 5.00% in August 2024? This will be answered with YES if the Bank of England's base rate is noted to be at or above 5.00% at any time during August 2024. Verification must come from official announcements by the Bank of England or at least two respected financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to have fallen below 5.00% and stays below this threshold throughout August 2024, the answer will be NO.

If the condition regarding the appointment of a new President in France is not satisfied, the question will be resolved as N/A.

Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.body:

2. Elon Musk must not be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must not be the interviewee.
4. The event must not be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must not be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. Fewer than two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If any of these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If all these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview occurs, the question resolves as NO.

The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence, be publicly accessible on the X platform, and reported by at least two major news outlets either before or after it takes place.

Given this, will Nvidia announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 31, 2024? For this to resolve as YES, Nvidia must officially announce specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations through official company channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. question.title: Will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. The 4,800 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,800 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

not_P.title: Will the S&P 500 index not reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. question.title: Given the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points by August 2024, will Shopify lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?

Then, is it true that Shopify will lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 31, 2024? question.title: Will Astellas allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Astellas officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Astellas continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Astellas does not continue to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Samsung announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Samsung only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

not_P.title: Will Samsung not announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung does not publicly announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The lack of announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or not reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if Samsung announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the lack of announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

para_P.title: Is Samsung expected to reveal intentions to expand its AI workforce before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung makes a public declaration regarding the expansion of its AI workforce. The declaration must occur through official company communication channels (like press releases, statements to investors, or verified social media accounts) or be covered by a minimum of two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or the Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI workforce must be clearly articulated and not merely suggested from broader hiring intentions. If no such declaration is made by the indicated date, or if Samsung only communicates intentions to sustain or reduce its AI workforce, the inquiry will be resolved as NO. It is important to highlight that this question pertains to the announcement of intentions, not the actual execution of those intentions.

question.title: Will the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's climate disclosure rule be reinstated by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's rule on climate disclosures, previously blocked by a court decision, is reinstated. The reinstatement must be confirmed by official court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The reinstatement could occur through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's decision, or any other legal mechanism that results in the rule taking effect. If the rule remains blocked or is not reinstated by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's climate disclosure rule not be reinstated by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's rule on climate disclosures, previously blocked by a court decision, is not reinstated. The reinstatement must not be confirmed by official court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The reinstatement could not occur through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's decision, or any other legal mechanism that results in the rule taking effect. If the rule is reinstated by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the climate disclosure regulation from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission be brought back by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, the climate disclosure regulation from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, which was previously halted by a judicial ruling, is restored. The restoration must be verified by official court documents or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The restoration could take place through a successful appeal, a reversal of the judicial ruling, or any other legal process that leads to the regulation being enforced. If the regulation remains halted or is not restored by the designated date, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: If the SEC's climate disclosure rule is reinstated by July 2024, will the NASDAQ Composite index reach or exceed 15,000 points by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's rule on climate disclosures, previously blocked by a court decision, is reinstated. The reinstatement must be confirmed by official court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The reinstatement could occur through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's decision, or any other legal mechanism that results in the rule taking effect.

Then, is it true that the NASDAQ Composite index will reach or exceed 15,000 points by August 31, 2024? This will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the NASDAQ Composite index reaches or exceeds 15,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the NASDAQ Stock Market. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 15,000 points.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the European Central Bank not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank does not officially announce a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The lack of announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the European Central Bank implement a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if the European Central Bank publicly declares a reduction in its primary refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the ECB or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal resolution made by the Governing Council of the ECB and conveyed in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any conjecture regarding future rate reductions or unofficial remarks by individual ECB officials will not be considered for resolution. If no such official declaration of an interest rate reduction is made by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as FALSE.

question.title: If the European Central Bank announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. This announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting.

Given this, will Hyundai Motor Company reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024? For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument for the Bank of England's monetary policy.

question.title: Conditional on the Bank of England announcing an interest rate cut by August 2024, will India eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?

If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the condition is not met.

Given this condition, will India eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 31, 2024? This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.
