The online offerings must be available to the general public within Washington and facilitate real-money transactions. Beta testing phases or limited releases to specific groups do not qualify.

Then, will Google successfully settle a significant workers' strike by July 31, 2024? This resolves to YES if Google comes to an agreement with unionized workers, bringing an end to a major strike by that date. The strike must involve no fewer than 1,000 participants, persist for at least one week, and the settlement must be validated by official statements from both Google and the union, and reported by at least two reputable international news outlets. If no such settlement takes place, or if no major strike occurs, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Washington Lottery offers online products, and (b) Google resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) The Washington Lottery has officially launched any of its products for online purchase or play. Confirmation must come from an official announcement by the Washington Lottery or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as local Washington newspapers, national news outlets, or industry-specific publications). The online products must be accessible to the general public within Washington and allow for real-money transactions. Beta testing phases or limited rollouts to select groups do not qualify for a YES resolution.

(b) Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If both conditions are not met by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Washington Lottery offers online products, nor (b) Google resolves a major workers' strike?
not_P.body:

(a) The Washington Lottery has officially launched any of its products for online purchase or play. The online products must be accessible to the general public within Washington and allow for real-money transactions. Beta testing phases or limited rollouts to select groups do not qualify for a YES resolution.

(b) Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If at least one of the conditions is met by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The Washington Lottery provides online options, and (b) Google settles a significant labor strike?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024:

(a) The Washington Lottery has officially introduced any of its products for online purchase or engagement. The online offerings must be available to the general populace within Washington and facilitate real-money transactions. Beta testing stages or restricted rollouts to select audiences do not qualify for a YES determination.

(b) Google comes to a consensus with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike. The strike must involve a considerable number of Google employees (at least 1,000 participants), persist for a minimum of one week, and the resolution must be validated by official communications from both Google and the participating union. Furthermore, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable global news agencies (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If both criteria are not satisfied by July 31, 2024, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India impose new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announces new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations. If no such new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do not specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India not impose new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) does not announce new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. The absence of such an announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). Any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, must remain unchanged and must not directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations. If such new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India introduce additional regulatory restrictions on Yes Bank's lending before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) declares new regulatory restrictions that specifically affect Yes Bank's lending activities. The declaration must be validated by official communications from the RBI or reported by at least two prominent Indian financial news organizations (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new restrictions must be separate from any current regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must have a direct effect on Yes Bank's lending practices. If no such new restrictions are declared by the given date, or if any declared restrictions do not specifically pertain to Yes Bank's lending activities, the resolution will be negative.

question.title: Conditional on the Reserve Bank of India imposing new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending, will the FAO announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announces new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations.

Then, will the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 31, 2024? The FAO must officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

If the condition regarding the RBI and Yes Bank is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on the Reserve Bank of India imposing new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending, will the FAO not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
not_P.body:

The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations.

Then, will the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 31, 2024? The FAO must officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments exceeds $400 million, the question resolves as YES.

If the condition regarding the RBI and Yes Bank is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If the Reserve Bank of India enforces new lending restrictions on Yes Bank, will the FAO declare new financial commitments exceeding $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body:

This announcement must be validated by official communications from the RBI or covered by at least two major Indian financial news organizations (like Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). The new restrictions must be separate from any current regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must have a direct effect on Yes Bank's lending activities.

Then, will the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) reveal new financial commitments that amount to over $400 million by July 31, 2024? The FAO is required to officially declare one or more new funding commitments that together exceed $400 million through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two credible news outlets (for example, Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must represent new initiatives or substantial expansions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously announced commitments. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Food and Agriculture Organization officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, this condition resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Food and Agriculture Organization does not officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must not be made through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and must not be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must not be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, and must be continuations of previously announced commitments. question.title: Will Washington's Medicaid expansion program enroll over 450,000 people by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if Washington's Medicaid expansion program has enrolled more than 450,000 residents by July 31, 2024. The enrollment count refers to the total number of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion program, not including those who were previously eligible for Medicaid.

question.title: Conditional on Washington's Medicaid expansion enrolling over 450,000 people by July 2024, will the Reserve Bank of Australia announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?

Then, will the Reserve Bank of Australia officially announce a decrease in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBA members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Huawei announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Huawei officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the French economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the French economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy manages to avoid entering a recession. For the context of this inquiry, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. A NO will be determined if the French economy faces two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the French economy avoiding a recession by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The French economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. Then is it true that the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure will report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024? For the inflation measure to resolve as YES, the increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Los Angeles by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Los Angeles, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Los Angeles rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the first phase of a major Native American drone delivery project in Texas be completed by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the first phase of a large-scale drone delivery project planned by a Native American tribe in Texas is completed. The tribe in question is the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas. Completion of the first phase must be confirmed through official announcements by the tribe or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Completion implies that the drone delivery infrastructure is established and ready for operation, even if full service has not yet begun. If the first phase of the project is not completed by July 31, 2024, or if there is insufficient evidence of its completion, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Zika virus outbreak over by August 2024?

If neither condition is met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are met by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that: (a) By August 2024, at least one more U.S. state will have established a 72-hour waiting period for voter registration, AND (b) Ohio will have eliminated the work requirement from its Medicaid program by July 2024?

This modification must be validated through official state announcements or reported by at least two significant news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the stipulation that beneficiaries need to work or participate in other qualifying activities to obtain Medicaid benefits. If both criteria are fulfilled, the question will be answered as YES. If either or both criteria are not fulfilled by their respective resolution dates, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Given the U.S. Senate passes a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% by August 2024, will New York hold a referendum on climate change policy by August 2024?

The referendum topic must directly address climate change, either proposing new measures or altering existing policies. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on climate change does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. question.title: Given U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024, will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor.

Then, will the Bank of England officially announce a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by July 31, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on the mpox outbreak in Nigeria being declared over by July 2024, will Congo receive mpox vaccines from the WHO by August 2024?

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. question.title: Given the Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, will the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement is confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the condition is not met.

Then, is it true that the German economy will avoid a recession by July 31, 2024? For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The outcome resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the German economy does not enter a recession. It resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Given the Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, will the German economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement is confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the condition is not met.

Then, is it true that the German economy will enter a recession by July 31, 2024? The outcome resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth. It resolves as NO if the German economy does not enter a recession.

para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Bank of England makes an official declaration of an interest rate reduction effective by August 31, 2024. Then, is it accurate to say that the German economy will evade a recession by July 31, 2024? For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The outcome is deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, the German economy does not fall into a recession. It is considered NO if the German economy suffers two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

The question resolves as YES if such an announcement is made by August 31, 2024. (2) The German economy must not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as YES if the German economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

question.title: If a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio is canceled by August 2024, will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body:

Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

Then, will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024? This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) It is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, this condition resolves as NO. For the purpose of this condition, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project. (2) South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, this condition resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. question.title: Conditional on the establishment of an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members by July 2024, will Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

Then, will Michigan conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024? For Michigan to hold such a referendum, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, and must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources, and the bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy. question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. question.title: Conditional on Sony Corporation resolving a major workers' strike by July 2024, will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this to be true, the strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

Given this condition, will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 31, 2024? For the outcome to resolve as YES, the United States must continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery, verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will the Australian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Australian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Australia steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by the end of July 2024, the Australian economy has not entered a recession. For this context, a recession is characterized by two back-to-back quarters of declining GDP growth as documented by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. Conversely, the answer will be NO if the Australian economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, through July 31, 2024.

question.title: Given the Australian economy avoids a recession by July 2024, will U.S. previously occupied home sales decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Australian economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this condition, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics, and the economy must not experience such a recession between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

Then, is it true that U.S. previously occupied home sales will show a decline for two consecutive months by July 31, 2024? This will resolve as YES if there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month, verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Michigan introduces a new law altering the restrictions on medical treatment for transgender youth by July 2024, and (b) Medicare reaches an agreement on drug pricing with a leading pharmaceutical firm by August 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) By July 31, 2024, the state of Michigan introduces a new law that changes or supersedes the current restrictions on medical treatment for transgender youth. The law's passage must be verified through official state legislative documentation and reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Michigan news outlets). The new legislation must specifically address and modify the existing limitations on medical treatment for transgender youth in Michigan. (b) By August 31, 2024, Medicare successfully negotiates drug prices with a prominent pharmaceutical company. This must be confirmed by official statements from Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another pertinent U.S. government agency. The negotiation must be covered by at least two credible news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If either of these conditions is not achieved by the respective deadline, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Russia's Federation Council not pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
not_P.body:

1. The bill must not be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must not be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If a bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Federation Council of Russia approve a significant economic reform legislation that President Putin is against by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Federation Council of Russia endorses a significant economic reform legislation that is clearly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To be considered:

1. The legislation must pertain to economic policy, including areas such as fiscal expenditure, taxation, or monetary matters.
2. It must receive approval from the Federation Council, regardless of its enactment as law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be distinctly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets in terms of its potential effects on the Russian economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is approved but fails to satisfy all the aforementioned conditions, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Russia's Federation Council passing a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin, will a major oil spill occur in the Beaufort Sea by August 2024?
question.body:

The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, and must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times), and the bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

Then, given this condition, will a major oil spill occur in the Beaufort Sea by August 31, 2024? A major oil spill is defined as a spill that is reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and causes significant environmental damage, requiring large-scale cleanup efforts. The spill must be directly linked to an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker in the Beaufort Sea. If no such spill occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of South Korea's base rate remain at or above 3.50% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of South Korea's base rate is reported to be at or above 3.50% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of South Korea announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Korea Herald). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 3.50% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on the Central Bank of South Korea's base rate remaining at or above 3.50% in August 2024, will Sony announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Central Bank of South Korea's base rate is at or above 3.50% at any point during August 2024, as confirmed by official announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Korea Herald). Then, will Sony announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 31, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The Central Bank of South Korea's base rate must be at or above 3.50% during August 2024. If it decreases below 3.50% and stays below throughout August, the condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Sony must publicly announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be through official channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. The increase must be explicitly stated.

not_P.title: Conditional on the Central Bank of South Korea's base rate remaining below 3.50% in August 2024, will Sony not announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Sony must not publicly announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 31, 2024. The lack of announcement must be through official channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. The increase must not be explicitly stated.

(b) Sony publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Sony only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, this condition is not met. Note that this condition is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans. If both conditions are satisfied, this question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank Indonesia communications, such as press releases, Board of Governors statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the BI 7-day reverse repo rate, which is the Central Bank of Indonesia's primary tool for monetary policy.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. The 130,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index does not reach 130,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 130,000 points.

not_P.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index not reach 130,000 points by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. The settlement must be officially announced by the parties involved or reported by at least two reputable national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If no such settlement is confirmed by the specified date, or if the case is dismissed or advances to trial without a settlement, this condition will not be satisfied. The inquiry will resolve as NO if either or both conditions are not met by the specified date.

question.title: Will the Australian Government announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian Government officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official government channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the government fleet or directly associated with governmental transportation. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Australian Government not announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?

If no such declaration occurs by the specified deadline, the inquiry will be considered negative.

question.title: Will Takeda allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Takeda continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Takeda not allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Takeda does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively enforcing its patent. This could be through continued enforcement of its patent rights, lack of a formal patent withdrawal, absence of a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that restricts generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers) stating that generic production will not be allowed. If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Takeda permit the manufacture of generic versions of its gastrointestinal medication by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, Takeda publicly declares or verifies that it will permit the manufacture of generic versions of its gastrointestinal medication, thereby choosing not to enforce its patent. This could occur through a formal withdrawal of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other method that facilitates unrestricted generic production. Verification must be provided through official statements from the company, communications from relevant regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such declaration or verification is made by the given date, or if Takeda persists in enforcing its patent rights, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Conditional on Takeda allowing generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024, will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers).

Given this, will the WHO declare, by August 31, 2024, that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency? For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

If the condition about Takeda is not met, the resolution is N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Takeda not allowing generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024, will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa still a global emergency by August 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Takeda does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent retention, a refusal to issue a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that restricts generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers).

Given this, will the WHO declare, by August 31, 2024, that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is still considered a global emergency? For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is still a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO makes such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that specifically addresses the East African outbreak and states it is no longer a global emergency.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak still a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

If the condition about Takeda is not met, the resolution is N/A.

para_P.title: If Takeda permits the generic manufacturing of its gastrointestinal medication by July 2024, will the WHO determine that the Rift Valley fever crisis in East Africa is no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: By July 31, 2024, Takeda publicly declares or verifies that it will permit the generic manufacturing of its gastrointestinal medication, effectively ceasing enforcement of its patent. This could occur through a formal patent retraction, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other method that facilitates unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must originate from official announcements by the company, statements from pertinent regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or significant national newspapers).

In light of this, will the WHO announce, by August 31, 2024, that the Rift Valley fever situation in East Africa is no longer regarded as a global emergency? For a YES outcome:

1. The WHO must issue a public statement explicitly indicating that the Rift Valley fever situation in East Africa is no longer deemed a global emergency.
2. This announcement must be covered by at least two major international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The announcement must specifically mention the East African Rift Valley fever situation, not a general global situation regarding Rift Valley fever.

The question will be resolved as NO if:
1. The WHO fails to make such an announcement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO issues a statement regarding Rift Valley fever that does not specifically pertain to the East African situation.
3. The WHO continues or escalates the emergency classification of the East African Rift Valley fever situation.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever situation no longer a global emergency before the start date of this question, the resolution will still be based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

If the condition regarding Takeda is unmet, the resolution will be N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Takeda allows generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024, and (b) the WHO declares the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By July 31, 2024, Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Takeda continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

2. By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   - The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   - This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   - The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if either of the above conditions is not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Takeda does not allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024, nor (b) the WHO does not declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa a global emergency by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. By July 31, 2024, Takeda does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent retention, a refusal of a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that restricts generic production. No confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Takeda allows generic production, the question resolves as NO.

2. By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is still considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   - The WHO must not make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   - This declaration must not be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   - The declaration must not specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, but rather to a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if both of the above conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both the following events will take place: (a) Takeda permits the generic manufacturing of its gastrointestinal medication by July 2024, and (b) the WHO announces that the Rift Valley fever crisis in East Africa is no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. By July 31, 2024, Takeda makes an official statement or confirmation that it will permit the generic production of its gastrointestinal medication, effectively ceasing to enforce its patent rights. This could occur through a formal withdrawal of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that allows for unrestricted generic production. Verification must come from official announcements by the company, statements from pertinent regulatory authorities, or reports by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or significant national newspapers). If no such confirmation or announcement occurs by the specified deadline, or if Takeda continues to uphold its patent rights, the inquiry will be answered negatively.

2. By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially states that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer regarded as a global emergency. For a YES answer:
   - The WHO must issue a public statement explicitly declaring that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer deemed a global emergency.
   - This declaration must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   - The statement must specifically address the outbreak of Rift Valley fever in East Africa, rather than a global situation regarding Rift Valley fever in general.

The inquiry will be answered negatively if either of the aforementioned criteria is unmet.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

not_P.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims not exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, does not exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

para_P.title: Will the number of weekly jobless claims in the U.S. surpass 300,000 for three straight weeks before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if the weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, go over 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. It will be considered NO if this scenario does not occur within the given period. For the purpose of resolution, only the official statistics released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

question.title: Given U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks, will US airline mechanics remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question considers the scenario where the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States exceeds 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor. Given this situation, will airline mechanics in the United States remain on strike or not fully resume normal operations by August 31, 2024? The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from the airlines, the unions representing the mechanics, or the US government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters). The question resolves as YES if mechanics are still on strike or not fully operational by the end of August 2024, and NO if they have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024.

not_P.title: Given U.S. weekly jobless claims do not exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks, will US airline mechanics fully resume normal operations by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question considers the scenario where the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States does not exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor. Given this situation, will airline mechanics in the United States fully resume normal operations by August 31, 2024? The status of the work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from the airlines, the unions representing the mechanics, or the US government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters). The question resolves as YES if mechanics have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, and NO if they are still on strike or not fully operational by the end of August 2024.

para_P.title: If weekly jobless claims in the U.S. surpass 300,000 for three straight weeks, will airline mechanics in the U.S. continue their strike until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry examines the situation where the weekly initial claims for unemployment benefits in the United States exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any time leading up to August 31, 2024, according to the U.S. Department of Labor. In light of this development, will airline mechanics across the United States persist in their strike or fail to completely resume regular operations by August 31, 2024? The determination of the strike's status or the resumption of work must be validated by official announcements from the airlines, the unions that represent the mechanics, or the U.S. government, and reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters). The outcome is considered YES if the mechanics are still striking or have not fully resumed operations by the end of August 2024, and NO if they have completely returned to work and normal operations have been restored prior to or during August 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks and (b) US airline mechanics remain on strike?
question.body: This combined question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered for this condition. (b) Airline mechanics in the United States are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute by August 31, 2024. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from the airlines, the unions representing the mechanics, or the US government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters). If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by August 2024: (a) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks nor (b) US airline mechanics remain on strike?
not_P.body: This combined question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered for this condition. (b) Airline mechanics in the United States are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute by August 31, 2024. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from the airlines, the unions representing the mechanics, or the US government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters). If either condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two situations take place: (a) The weekly jobless claims in the U.S. surpass 300,000 for three weeks in a row and (b) Airline mechanics in the U.S. continue to be on strike?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by August 31, 2024: (a) The weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. Only data officially released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be used for this criterion. (b) U.S. airline mechanics are still on strike or have not completely returned to normal operations following any ongoing labor dispute by August 31, 2024. The confirmation of the strike status or return to work must be provided by official announcements from the airlines, the unions representing the mechanics, or the U.S. government, and reported by at least two credible news outlets (like The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters). If both criteria are met, the answer will be YES. If either criterion is not met, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Reserve Bank of India makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from official communications by the Reserve Bank of India or be reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal resolution made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or during a press briefing post-meeting. Any conjectures about potential rate reductions or unofficial comments from individual RBI members will not be taken into account for resolution. If there is no such official declaration of an interest rate reduction by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Given the Reserve Bank of India announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Singapore announce a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. This announcement is confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut is a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting.

Then, will the Central Bank of Singapore officially announce a new exchange rate policy by August 31, 2024? The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore, and it must explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore maintains the current exchange rate policy, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Given the Reserve Bank of India does not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Singapore not announce a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. This announcement is not confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut is not a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and not communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting.

Then, will the Central Bank of Singapore not officially announce a new exchange rate policy by August 31, 2024? The announcement must not come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore, and it must not explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must not be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore changes the current exchange rate policy, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will LG Electronics resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if LG Electronics reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of LG Electronics workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both LG Electronics and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

question.title: Conditional on LG Electronics resolving a major workers' strike by July 2024, will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US fall below 6.2% by August 2024?
question.body:

Then, will the Bank of England officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Indiana hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Indiana state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.
