question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Russia not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia does not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields not meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must not be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). The announcement must come from an official government source and be reported by at least two major international news outlets, indicating no intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned. If such an announcement is made, or if it only reaffirms the existing plan, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: If Russia confirms a successful winter harvest for wheat and barley, will they reveal intentions to construct more nuclear reactors in addition to the existing two by July 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, Russia announces a successful winter harvest for wheat and barley, marked by yields that meet or surpass the average of the last five years, with production at least 5% higher than the five-year average, validated by official agricultural statistics or at least three credible news outlets. In light of this, will Russia disclose plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the two currently proposed by July 31, 2024? The announcement must originate from an official government entity and be covered by at least two major international news organizations, showing an intention to develop further reactors beyond the two already in the pipeline. If no such declaration is made, or if it merely reiterates the current proposal, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024 (b) Russia announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this component, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, this part resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024 or (b) Russia announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: 

(a) By August 31, 2024, Russia does not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields not meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The lack of success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or by fewer than three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this component, 'not successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being less than or equal to 5% below the five-year average. If the winter crop season meets these criteria, or if sufficient data is available to make a determination, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government does not officially announce plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The lack of announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be reported by fewer than two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must not clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, including only expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, this part resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES only if at least one of (a) or (b) resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Are both of the following conditions expected to happen: (a) Russia will declare a fruitful winter harvest for wheat and barley by August 2024 and (b) Russia will reveal intentions to construct additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as YES if both of these conditions are satisfied: 

(a) By August 31, 2024, Russia declares a fruitful winter harvest for wheat and barley, marked by yields that meet or exceed the average of the last five years. This success must be validated by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three credible news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this condition, 'fruitful' is defined as the total output of wheat and barley being at least 5% greater than the five-year average. If the winter harvest does not fulfill these requirements, or if there is insufficient data to reach a conclusion, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially discloses intentions to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must originate from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be covered by at least two major international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must explicitly state a plan to construct more reactors beyond the two already proposed, rather than merely expanding or modifying the existing plans. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or updates the existing two-reactor plan, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

If no such announcement occurs by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding pledges does not surpass $400 million, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Given the UNDP announces over $400 million in new funding by July 2024, will a major hospital system in France cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. 

Then, will a major hospital system in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancel more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions by August 31, 2024? The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Pennsylvania is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). question.title: Conditional on Pennsylvania receiving over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024, will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the state of Pennsylvania is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Pennsylvania.

Then, is it true that Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. will resolve a major workers' strike by July 31, 2024? For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given the NEA endorses Kamala Harris by July 2024, will she announce her running mate at a Philadelphia rally by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the National Education Association (NEA) officially endorses Kamala Harris for the presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official NEA statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post).

Then, is the following true? By August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally.

Resolution criteria: If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Philadelphia rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Tesla announcing additional layoffs beyond 6%, will General Motors resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:

Condition: Tesla must officially announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. Outcome: Resolves YES if General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. The strike must involve at least 1,000 GM workers, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both General Motors and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

question.title: Given Universal Studios Hollywood workers approve a new labor agreement by July 2024, will the Central Bank of the Philippines announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?

This approval must be confirmed by official union announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers. The agreement must be related to the negotiations mentioned in recent news about avoiding a potential strike. 

Then, will the Central Bank of the Philippines officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024? This announcement must be confirmed by official Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas communications, such as press releases, Monetary Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which is the Central Bank of the Philippines' primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will New York conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will New York not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York holds a public vote explicitly aimed at securing abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of New York.
2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on the protection of abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be made public through official state channels or well-established news organizations.

If such a vote fulfilling these requirements does not take place by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered as NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually carrying it out by the designated date does not meet the criteria for a YES outcome.

question.title: Conditional on New York conducting a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, will New Jersey hold a referendum on affordable housing by July 2024?

Then, will New Jersey hold a referendum on enshrining affordable housing in its state constitution by July 31, 2024? This requires confirmation through official state announcements or coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations, and the referendum must specifically address the protection of affordable housing in the state constitution.

If New York does not conduct such a referendum by the specified date, the conditional question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address abortion rights, either proposing to enshrine protections or to restrict/ban abortion. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on abortion does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil announce a new inflation target by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil officially announces a new inflation target. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Brazil communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the President of the Central Bank of Brazil. The announcement should explicitly state the new inflation target. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil maintains the current inflation target, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will Kansas hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). question.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce a new monetary easing policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?

question.title: Given a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancels over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024, will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?

Then, will Hyundai Motor Company reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024? For the resolution to be considered valid:

question.title: Conditional on WHO declaring the West Nile virus outbreak over, will Land O'Frost recall deli meats due to listeria by August 2024?
question.body:
This question examines whether Land O'Frost will issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 31, 2024, conditional on the World Health Organization (WHO) declaring the current West Nile virus outbreak over by the same date.

Condition: The WHO must officially declare the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC).

Outcome: The question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If North Carolina implements a new statute changing the regulations on medical treatment for transgender minors by July 2024, will Georgia organize a public vote on healthcare reform by August 2024?

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

The reduction must not be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must not be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

The decrease must pertain to the monetary policy rate, which is the primary instrument of the Central Bank of Chile for impacting the economy. If such an announcement is not made by the designated date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Conditional on the Central Bank of Chile announcing a rate cut by August 2024, will U.S. home sales decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Central Bank of Chile announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction.

Given this condition, will the following outcome occur: By July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO?

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the World Health Organization not declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially announces that the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak has ended by August 31, 2024. The outbreak in question is the one that led the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. question.title: Given the WHO declares the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024, will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
question.body:

This declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). Then, will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 31, 2024? This will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements, and be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera). The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023, and only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered. The type of polio does not matter for this question. If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?

The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on the Central Bank of Chile announcing a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, will Brazil's monthly job growth fall below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement is officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction is in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction.

Then, is it true that Brazil's monthly job growth falls below 50,000 in any single month by July 31, 2024? This resolves as YES if Brazil records a monthly job growth figure below 50,000 in any official jobs report confirmed by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly employment reports. Job growth refers to the net change in employment. Revisions to previous months' data will not be considered for this question's resolution. If job growth does not fall below 50,000 in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Indian economy experience a recession by July 2024?

question.title: Given the Indian economy avoids a recession by July 2024, will the Swiss National Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body:
This question combines two forecasting scenarios:

1. Indian Economy Recession Avoidance: This part of the question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. It resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

2. Swiss National Bank Interest Rate Cut: This part resolves as YES if the Swiss National Bank officially announces a decrease in its policy rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Swiss National Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Charlotte by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Charlotte, North Carolina. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Charlotte rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not announce her running mate at a rally in Charlotte by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris does not publicly announce her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Charlotte, North Carolina. The announcement must not be made by Harris herself during the rally and must not clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must not be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does make such an announcement at a Charlotte rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris declare her vice presidential candidate at a gathering in Charlotte before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris officially reveals her choice for running mate for the forthcoming election during a gathering in Charlotte, North Carolina. The declaration must be made by Harris personally at the event and must distinctly name the individual selected as her running mate. The occurrence and announcement must be validated by at least two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours following the gathering. If Harris fails to make such a declaration at a Charlotte gathering by the conclusion of August 2024, or if the announcement occurs via alternative methods or at a different venue, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: GIVEN Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in Charlotte by August 2024, will Minnesota hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Charlotte, North Carolina. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally.

Then, will Minnesota officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024? For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Minnesota state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Charlotte, North Carolina. 1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the Minnesota state government.
2. The referendum must not explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as YES if:

1. Such a referendum does not occur by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: IF Kamala Harris reveals her choice for running mate at a gathering in Charlotte before August 2024, will Minnesota hold a vote on abortion rights by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris makes a public declaration of her running mate for the upcoming election during a gathering in Charlotte, North Carolina. This announcement must be made directly by Harris at the event and must clearly specify who her running mate is. The occurrence of the event and the announcement should be verified by at least two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within a 24-hour period following the rally.

Then, will Minnesota officially carry out a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state by August 31, 2024? For a positive outcome:

1. The vote must be formally announced and executed by the Minnesota state administration.
2. The vote must directly address the matter of safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be publicly disclosed by official state communications or widely acknowledged news outlets.

The question will be considered NO if:

1. No such vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled vote is cancelled or delayed beyond the indicated date.
3. A vote is conducted, but it does not specifically target the establishment of protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not evaluate the results of the vote, only whether it occurs within the given timeframe.

The question will resolve as NO if either of these events does not occur by August 31, 2024, according to the specified criteria for each event.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will there be a rally in Charlotte where Kamala Harris names her running mate and a referendum on abortion rights in Minnesota?

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Illinois not hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must not be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must not be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if such a referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must not be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is a public vote on healthcare reform expected in Illinois before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Illinois carries out an official public vote specifically aimed at implementing healthcare reform within the state. The vote must be formally declared by the Illinois Secretary of State or another designated state election authority, and it must be arranged to occur on or prior to August 31, 2024. The question posed in the vote must directly relate to healthcare reform. This inquiry will be marked as negative if no such public vote is officially announced or executed by the indicated date. It is important to note that simply collecting signatures for a possible vote does not meet the criteria for an affirmative resolution; the actual vote must be planned or conducted within the given period.

question.title: Conditional on Illinois holding a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024, will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a health savings account requirement by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform, as announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. 

Then, will another U.S. state, besides Georgia, officially adopt a Medicaid plan that includes a health savings account requirement for beneficiaries by July 31, 2024? For a YES resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. 

If the condition about Illinois is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Illinois not holding a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024, will another U.S. state not adopt a Medicaid plan with a health savings account requirement by July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform, as announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform. 

Then, will another U.S. state, besides Georgia, not officially adopt a Medicaid plan that includes a health savings account requirement for beneficiaries by July 31, 2024? For a YES resolution, there must be no official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or inconsistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must not be officially adopted, merely proposed or under consideration. If another state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as YES. 

If the condition about Illinois is met, this question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Illinois proceeds with a public vote on healthcare reform by August 2024, will any other U.S. state implement a Medicaid program that mandates a health savings account by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, Illinois will carry out a public vote aimed at implementing healthcare reform, as declared by the Illinois Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority, and this vote is set to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the referendum must specifically pertain to healthcare reform. 

Consequently, will any U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially establish a Medicaid program that requires a health savings account for its beneficiaries by July 31, 2024? For a YES outcome, there must be an official declaration from the state government or the state’s Medicaid agency, or reliable coverage from at least two respected national news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially enacted, not just proposed or under review. If no other state adopts such a program by July 31, 2024, the conclusion will be NO. 

If the stipulation regarding Illinois is not fulfilled, this question will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Will both Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024 and another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a health savings account requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES only if both of the following occur: (a) By August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. Merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe. (b) By July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a health savings account requirement for beneficiaries. The health savings account requirement must be a key component of the plan. There must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If both conditions (a) and (b) are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will either Illinois not hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024 or another U.S. state not adopt a Medicaid plan with a health savings account requirement by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES only if at least one of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform. The referendum must not be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must not be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform. Merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must not be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe. (b) By July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a health savings account requirement for beneficiaries. The health savings account requirement must not be a key component of the plan. There must be no official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must not be officially adopted, merely proposed or under consideration. If either condition (a) or (b) is met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Illinois conduct a public vote on healthcare reform by August 2024 and will another U.S. state implement a Medicaid program that requires a health savings account by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE only if both of the following take place: (a) By August 31, 2024, Illinois officially holds a public vote specifically aimed at implementing healthcare reform. This vote must be officially declared by the Illinois Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority, and it must be scheduled for on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the vote must directly relate to healthcare reform. Simply collecting signatures for a potential vote does not qualify for a TRUE resolution; the actual vote must be scheduled or conducted within the given timeframe. (b) By July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially adopts a Medicaid program that incorporates a health savings account requirement for its beneficiaries. The health savings account requirement must be an essential element of the program. There must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from at least two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially adopted, not just proposed or under consideration. If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, the inquiry resolves as TRUE; otherwise, it resolves as FALSE.

question.title: Will Rome announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of Rome officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within Rome's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Rome not announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of Rome does not officially announce plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must not come from an official source within Rome's local government and not be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should not be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will still not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If such an official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the city of Rome unveil intentions to limit short-term rental properties before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the municipal government of Rome publicly reveals plans or regulations designed to restrict or decrease the number of short-term rental properties (such as those commonly found on platforms like Airbnb) in the city. The announcement must originate from an official entity within Rome's local government and be covered by at least two credible international news outlets. The regulations or plans should specifically aim to lower the availability of short-term rental properties for tourists or change their operational methods. Simple discussions or proposals without a formal declaration will not suffice for a YES outcome. If no such formal declaration is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given Rome announces plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024, will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the city government of Rome officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units within the city. This announcement must come from an official source within Rome's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations, targeting the reduction of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering their operation.

Then, will the European Central Bank officially announce a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting.

not_P.title: Given Rome announces plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024, will the European Central Bank not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the city government of Rome officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units within the city. This announcement must come from an official source within Rome's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations, targeting the reduction of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering their operation.

para_P.title: If the city of Rome reveals intentions to limit short-term rental properties by July 2024, will the European Central Bank declare a reduction in interest rates by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By July 31, 2024, the municipal authorities in Rome formally disclose plans or regulations aimed at curtailing the number of short-term rental properties in the city. This declaration must originate from an official entity within Rome's local administration and be covered by at least two credible international news outlets, focusing on decreasing the availability of short-term rentals for tourists or modifying their operations.

This announcement must be validated through official communications from the ECB or reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations. The interest rate decrease must be a formal resolution made by the Governing Council of the ECB and conveyed in their official statement or press briefing following a meeting.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Rome announces plans to restrict short-term rental units, and (b) the European Central Bank announces an interest rate cut?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by July 31, 2024: (a) The city government of Rome officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within Rome's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. (b) The European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If either or both of these announcements do not occur by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Rome announces plans to restrict short-term rental units, nor (b) the European Central Bank announces an interest rate cut?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occur by July 31, 2024: (a) The city government of Rome does not officially announce plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units within the city. The absence of an announcement from an official source within Rome's local government and reporting by at least two reputable international news organizations will indicate a NO resolution. The lack of restrictions or regulations specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate will also contribute to a NO resolution. (b) The European Central Bank does not officially announce a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate. The absence of confirmation through official statements from the ECB or reporting by at least two major financial news sources will indicate a NO resolution. The lack of a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and the absence of communication in their official statement or press conference following a meeting will also contribute to a NO resolution. If either or both of these announcements occur by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Rome's government reveals intentions to limit short-term rental properties, and (b) the European Central Bank declares a reduction in interest rates?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of the following happen by July 31, 2024: (a) The local government of Rome makes an official declaration or regulation aimed at constraining or limiting the number of short-term rental properties available in the city. This announcement must originate from an official entity within Rome's municipal government and be covered by at least two credible international news outlets. The measures or regulations should specifically aim to decrease the availability of short-term rental units for tourists or change their operational framework. (b) The European Central Bank makes an official announcement regarding a reduction in its primary refinancing rate. This announcement must be validated through official communications from the ECB or reported by at least two prominent financial news agencies. The interest rate reduction must be a formal decision by the ECB's Governing Council and conveyed in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any conjecture about potential future rate cuts or unofficial comments from individual ECB members will not be considered for resolution. If either or both of these announcements do not take place by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Swiss National Bank announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Swiss National Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official SNB communications, such as press releases, statements, or public speeches by SNB officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the policy rate, which is the SNB's primary tool for monetary policy.

not_P.title: Will the Swiss National Bank not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Swiss National Bank does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The absence of such an announcement must be confirmed by official SNB communications, such as press releases, statements, or public speeches by SNB officials. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself does not occur by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the policy rate, which is the SNB's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Swiss National Bank will declare a reduction in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if the Swiss National Bank makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in interest rates that is set to take effect by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come through official communications from the SNB, including press releases, statements, or public addresses by SNB representatives. If no such declaration occurs by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be considered FALSE. It is important to note that the actual date for implementing the rate reduction can occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the policy rate, which is the main instrument for the SNB's monetary policy.

question.title: Conditional on the Swiss National Bank announcing an interest rate cut by August 2024, will Brazil's monthly job growth fall below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Swiss National Bank (SNB) officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. This announcement is confirmed by official SNB communications, such as press releases, statements, or public speeches by SNB officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the condition is not met.

Given this condition, the question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Brazil records a monthly job growth figure below 50,000 in any official jobs report. The data must be confirmed by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly employment reports. Job growth refers to the net change in employment. Revisions to previous months' data will not be considered for this question's resolution. If job growth does not fall below 50,000 in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Conditional on the Swiss National Bank announcing an interest rate cut by August 2024, will Brazil's monthly job growth not fall below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Swiss National Bank (SNB) officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. This announcement is confirmed by official SNB communications, such as press releases, statements, or public speeches by SNB officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the condition is not met.

Given this condition, the question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Brazil does not record a monthly job growth figure below 50,000 in any official jobs report. The data must be confirmed by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly employment reports. Job growth refers to the net change in employment. Revisions to previous months' data will not be considered for this question's resolution. If job growth falls below 50,000 in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Assuming the Swiss National Bank will declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024, will Brazil's monthly employment increase dip below 50,000 in any month leading up to July 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: The Swiss National Bank (SNB) makes an official announcement regarding a decrease in interest rates set to take effect by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be validated by official communications from the SNB, including press releases, statements, or public addresses by SNB representatives. Under this condition, the outcome is YES if, by July 31, 2024, Brazil reports a monthly employment increase that is below 50,000 in any official job report. This data must be verified by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly employment statistics. Job growth pertains to the net change in employment figures. Adjustments to data from prior months will not factor into the resolution of this question. If job growth remains above 50,000 for every month from October 2023 to July 2024, then the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the UK economy enter a recession by July 2024?

The response will be NO if the UK economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the UK economy avoiding a recession by July 2024, will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its beverage products by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. Given this condition, will PepsiCo report an increase in North American demand for its beverage products by July 31, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its beverage products compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for its beverage products in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Buenos Aires announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of Buenos Aires officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. question.title: Will the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the South Korean economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy enters a recession. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the South Korean economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?

A recession is characterized for this purpose as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The inquiry will be deemed FALSE if the South Korean economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the South Korean economy avoiding a recession by July 2024, will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the South Korean economy's performance and the WHO's declaration regarding the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria. 

Suppose the following is true: 
- The South Korean economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea within the period from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

Then, is the following also true? 
- By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For this to resolve as YES:
  1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
  2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
  3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question resolves as NO if the WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024, or if it maintains or escalates the emergency status of the outbreak.

  1. The WHO must not make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
  2. This declaration must not be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
  3. The declaration must not specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, but rather a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question resolves as YES if the WHO does make such a declaration by August 31, 2024, or if it maintains or escalates the emergency status of the outbreak.

question.title: Will a new AI platform be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a new AI platform is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the new AI platform and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Missouri conduct a referendum on healthcare access by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying healthcare access policies in the state. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case, related to healthcare access. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, or if the referendum is postponed beyond August 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will Missouri not conduct a referendum on healthcare access by August 2024?

For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case, related to healthcare access. para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Missouri regarding healthcare access before the end of August 2024?

In this context, a 'public vote' means a direct decision made by the voters on a specific proposal, in this instance, concerning healthcare access. question.title: Given Missouri conducts a referendum on healthcare access by August 2024, will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case, related to healthcare access. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, or if the referendum is postponed beyond August 31, 2024.

Then, will Arizona officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024? For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Arizona state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will NTT Group publicly confirm a payment to a hacker to erase sensitive data by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, NTT Group publicly confirms through an official statement or press release that they made a payment to a hacker to erase sensitive data. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The payment must be specifically for erasing sensitive data, not for other purposes. If no such confirmation is made by NTT Group or if NTT Group denies making such a payment, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question does not consider unofficial statements, leaks, or speculations as valid confirmations.

question.title: Given NTT Group confirms a payment to a hacker by July 2024, will the U.S. economy avoid a recession by then?

If no such confirmation is made by NTT Group or if NTT Group denies making such a payment, the condition is not met.

Then, is the following true: By July 31, 2024, the U.S. economy does not enter a recession. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis. The question resolves as NO if the U.S. economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.
